column4: anyone know of a good way to convert a lot of files from mp3 to wav?
someone above provided: "ls *.mp3 | xargs -i sh -c "echo {} | sed s/.mp3//g | xargs -i% sox %.mp3 %.wav"" to convert mp3 to wav, so I was wondering what the %'s do

As someone else pointed out, the "-i" option is used to create a string substitution.  Each input line will be called %, and the subsequent references to % will be replaced with each input line and executed.
